activities.description: Having breakfast at home to save money and gain energy (+30). Current grocery level is sufficient (64).
Traveling to work. This will cost 1 energy for the step plus natural decay.
Starting my work shift. Will lose 10 energy this hour (5 work + 5 natural decay).
Continuing work shift. Another 10 energy loss.
Taking a short nap during lunch break to recover +10 energy.
Eating lunch at work since it's convenient. Spending $20 for +40 energy.
Returning to work after lunch. 10 energy loss this hour.
Continuing work shift. 10 energy loss.
Final hour of work shift. 10 energy loss.
Heading to Local Market after work to restock groceries.
Buying groceries to replenish home supplies. Spending $36 to increase grocery level from 54 to 90.
Returning home after grocery shopping.
Having dinner at home to save money. Using groceries (+30 energy, -10 grocery level).
Traveling to the restaurant because my energy is critically low and I need food immediately.
Eating a meal to replenish my energy and avoid further health risks.
